Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of one band in added white above trace of second; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion's leg to left; below, in handle zone, part of double guilloche pattern and decoration around handle root (now lost) consisting of vertical and horizontal lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by World Museum, Liverpool. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 579, pl. 73)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0611) (phase 2)
